Package Business

Class UserModel

java.lang.Object
Business.UserModel
public class UserModel
extends java.lang.Object
The Type User Model will create the bridge between our Users and the Database, managing things like the logic behind the Register and Login Validations, by means of the following Regex expressions:

(?=.*\d) Has a Digit. (?=.*[a-z]) Has LowerCase. (?=.*[A-Z]) Has Upper Case. (?=.*[@#$%]) Has these symbols: @, #, $, %. {8,20}$ Larger or equal than 8, smaller or equal than 20. Full regex expression = "^(?=.*\\d)(?=.*[a-z])(?=.*[A-Z])(?=.*[@#$%]).{8,20}$";

    • isValidPassword

      public void isValidPassword​(java.lang.String password, boolean[] allGood)
      Function meant to execute all regexChecks to validate a Password from an User wishing to Register.
      Parameters:
      password - The password introduced by user during Register
      allGood - the allGood boolean checking no errors found.

      Is valid user boolean will check for a match between user given and Database.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the boolean indicating there have been no errors during validation.
